project.summary: An interactive style guide compliance tool powered by Claude (Anthropic). Select a content type, paste your copy, and get instant rewrites with rule-by-rule explanations citing the Microsoft Writing Style Guide.

section.heading: About This Tool
section.body:
This is a working tool, not a static mockup. It calls Claude (Anthropic's LLM) through a Cloudflare Worker endpoint, with the Microsoft Writing Style Guide distilled into the system prompt.

It demonstrates prompt engineering, API integration, structured output parsing, and content design knowledge applied to a real editorial workflow.

section.heading: How It Works
section.body:
The editor runs on three layers:

  1. Content-type-aware prompting. Each content type (error messages, UI labels, help docs) loads a different set of Microsoft Style Guide rules into the system prompt. Error messages get rules about blame-free language and conciseness. UI labels get capitalization and verb-first patterns. Help docs get procedural writing and second-person rules.
  2. Structured output. The LLM returns JSON with the revised copy, a list of individual changes (each citing a specific rule), and an overall summary. This makes the output parseable and presentable rather than a blob of freeform text.
  3. Server-side proxy. The browser sends a POST request to a Cloudflare Worker endpoint (/api/style-check), which holds the API key and forwards the request to Anthropic's Messages API. No credentials are exposed client-side.

Rules coverage

The system prompt includes Microsoft's top 10 style and voice principles (brevity, active voice, contractions, sentence-style capitalization, Oxford commas, etc.) plus 10 content-type-specific rules per category. The rules are distilled from the Microsoft Writing Style Guide rather than RAG'd from the full document, keeping token usage low and responses fast.
